<page sig="Kk7v"> 
<wordgroup1 type="a" object="I"><alpha>I</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Iacob(pn)">IAcob,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; originally in the Hebr. call'd 
<etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B7;&#x05E2;&#x05B2;&#x05E7;&#x05D5;&#x05D1;</etym> <etym lang="het">jahakobh</etym>; from the Root <etym lang="he">&#x05E2;&#x05B8;&#x05E7;&#x05B5;&#x05D1;</etym> the heel; so call'd, 
because being twin-brother to Esau, he held him by the 
heel with his hand in the Birth, which Hieroglyphick 
was afterwards verify'd in his supplanting his Brother, and 
getting the Blessing and Inheritance for himself.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Iames(pn)">Iames,</form> <xpln lang="en">the same with <etym lang="en">Iacob</etym> above.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Ieremy(pn)">Ieremy,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B4;&#x05E8;&#x05B0;&#x05DE;&#x05B0;&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;&#x05D9;&#x05B4;&#x05E8;&#x05B0;&#x05DE;&#x05B0;&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;</etym>, compounded 
of <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05E8;&#x05B4;&#x05D9;&#x05DD;</etym> to exalt, and <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B0;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> Jehovah, the Lord; <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  one 
that will magnifie the Lord. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F39;&epsilon;&rho;&epsilon;&mu;&#x1F77;&alpha;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Jeremias,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Iob(pn)">Iob,</form> <xpln lang="en">the Name of a Man; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05D0;&#x05B4;&#x05D9;&#x05D5;&#x05D1;</etym> <etym lang="het">Ijob</etym>, this from 
the Root <etym lang="he">&#x05D0;&#x05B8;&#x05D9;&#x05B7;&#x05D1;</etym> to indure injuries, or, suffer affronts, <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  patient. 
Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F38;&#x1F7C;&beta;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Job,</etym> or <etym lang="la">Jobus, id.</etym> </xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Iohn(pn)">Iohn,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; originally in the Hebr. it was <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B0;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;&#x05C4;&#x05D7;&#x05B8;&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym>, 
<etym lang="het">Jehochanan</etym>, or <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05D5;&#x05D7;&#x05B8;&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym> <etym lang="het">Jochanan</etym>, compounded of <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B0;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> <etym lang="het">jehovah</etym>, the Name of God Almighty, and <etym lang="he">&#x05D7;&#x05B6;&#x05DF;</etym> grace, which is again de&shy;
rived from <etym lang="he">&#x05D7;&#x05B8;&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym> he hath been gracious; by interpretation as a&shy;
bove it signifies, the grace of God. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F38;&omega;&sigma;&#x1F77;&alpha;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Jo&shy;
hannes</etym>, id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Ionas(pn)" lexeme="Ionah(pn)">Ionas or Ionah,</form> <xpln lang="en">the Name of a Man. Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05D5;&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> Jonah (which 
also signifies a Dove or Pidgeon), derived <emend err="foom">from</emend> the Root <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> 
<etym lang="het">janah</etym>, he or it oppressed or afflicted; for a Dove through its 
harmlesness becomes a prey to the more Ravenous Fowls that 
with strength oppress it. Jonah signifies a Dove-like temper of 
mind. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F38;&omega;&nu;&#x1FB6;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Jonas,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Ioseph(pn)">Ioseph,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05D5;&#x05E1;&#x05E3;</etym> <etym lang="het">id</etym>. this from 
the Root <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05E1;&#x05B7;&#x05E3;</etym>, he hath added. It signifies, he doth, or may add, 
pursuant to his Mother Rachel's desiring God to give her more 
Sons. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F38;&omega;&sigma;&#x1F74;&phi;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Josephus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Iosias(pn)">Iosias,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05D0;&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B4;&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;&#x05BC;</etym>, <etym lang="het">Ioschijahu</etym>, 
which is again derived from <etym lang="he">&#x05D0;&#x05B5;&#x05E9;&#x05C1;</etym>, fire, and <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B0;&#x05D4;&#x05D5;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> <etym lang="het">Jehovah</etym>, 
Lord; <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  the fire of the Lord. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F38;&omega;&sigma;&#x1F77;&alpha;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Josias,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Isaac(pn)">Isaac,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05D9;&#x05B4;&#x05E6;&#x05B0;&#x05D7;&#x05B7;&#x05E7;</etym>, id. this from the 
Root <etym lang="he">&#x05E6;&#x05B8;&#x05D7;&#x05B7;&#x05E7;</etym>, he laughed; the word Isaac in the Original signi&shy;
fies, he shall, or, he will laugh. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1F38;&sigma;&alpha;&#x1F70;&kappa;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Isaacus</etym> or 
<etym lang="la">Isaac,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 
</page> 

<page sig="Kk8r"> 
<wordgroup1 type="a" object="L"><alpha>L</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Lettuce(pn)">LEttice,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; from the Lat. <etym lang="la">L&aelig;titia,</etym> which 
signifies Joy, Gladness, or Glee.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Love(pn)">Love,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; 'tis of an English Original , and 
render'd in Lat. by Amorea.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Lucrece(pn)">Lucrece,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; derived from the Lat. <etym lang="la">Lucretia,</etym> which 
was the Name of the Roman Dame, that for the Rape com&shy;
mitted upon her by Sixtus Tarquinius, stabb'd her self in the 
presence of her Husband, Father, and others.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Lucy(pn)">Lucy,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; from the Lat. <etym lang="la">Lucia,</etym> which may again 
be derived from the Lat. <etym lang="la">Luceo,</etym> to shine; or from <etym lang="la">Lux,</etym> light.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Luke(pn)">Luke,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Lambda;&omicron;&upsilon;&kappa;&#x1FB6;&#x03c2;</etym>, which is the same 
with <etym lang="la">Lucius</etym> of the Roman's, that is so call'd <etym lang="la">&agrave; Luce,</etym> from the 
Light, this Name being usually given such as were born just as 
the Sun rises.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="M"><alpha>M</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Magdalen(pn)" lexeme="Maudlin(pn)">MAgdalen or Maudlin,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; in the Syr. 
<etym lang="sy">&#x05DE;&#x05B7;&#x05D2;&#x05D3;&#x05BC;&#x05B0;&#x05DC;&#x05B6;&#x05D9;&#x05D7;&#x05B8;&#x05D0;</etym> <etym lang="syt">Magdeletha</etym>, that is, florid, crescent or 
magnificent; this from the Root <etym lang="sy">&#x05D2;&#x05B8;&#x05D3;&#x05B7;&#x05DC;</etym>, he was great 
or increased: Some say that Mary Magdalen was so call'd from 
<etym lang="he">Magdala,</etym> the name of the Village where she lived. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&alpha;&gamma;&delta;&alpha;&shy;
&lambda;&eta;&nu;&#x1F74;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Magdalene,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Margaret(pn)" lexeme="Marget(pn)">Margaret or Marget,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&alpha;&rho;&gamma;&alpha;&shy;
&rho;&#x1F77;&tau;&eta;&#x03c2;</etym>, or the Lat. <etym lang="la">Margarita,</etym> a Pearl.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Mark(pn)">Mark,</form> <xpln lang="en">the Name of a Man; from the Lat. <etym lang="la">Marcus,</etym> which name 
among the Romans was usually given to such as were born in 
the Month of March; though some, without any ground (it 
being purely a Roman Name) go about to draw it from the 
Hebr. &#x05DE;&#x05B8;&#x05E8;&#x05B7;&#x05E7; <etym lang="het">Marak</etym>, he polish'd or beautify'd.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Martha(pn)">Martha,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; It seems to be so call'd from the 
Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05B8;&#x05E8;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym>, bitterness. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&alpha;&rho;&theta;&#x1F70;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Martha,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Mary(pn)">Mary,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; originally <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05E8;&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05DD;</etym> <etym lang="het">Mirjam</etym>. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&alpha;&shy;
&rho;&iota;&#x1F71;&mu;</etym>; from the Root <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05B8;&#x05E8;&#x05B7;&#x05E8;</etym>, he was sad, whence <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05B8;&#x05E8;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> she 
was sad. Now in the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&alpha;&rho;&#x1F77;&alpha;</etym>, and Lat. <etym lang="la">Maria,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Matthew(pn)">Matthew,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; in the Syr. <etym lang="sy">&#x05DE;&#x05B7;&#x05EA;&#x05BC;&#x05B7;&#x05D9;</etym> <etym lang="syt">Matthai</etym>, from the 
Root <etym lang="sy">&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05EA;&#x05B7;&#x05DF;</etym> he hath given, whence <etym lang="sy">&#x05DE;&#x05B7;&#x05EA;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym> a gift; so that it is so 
call'd <term lang="la">quasi Deo datus</term>, <term lang="la">i.e.</term>  given of God. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&alpha;&tau;&theta;&alpha;&#x1FD6;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. 
<etym lang="la">Matth&aelig;us,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</page> 

<page sig="Kk8v"> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Michael(pn)">Michael,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05B4;&#x05D9;&#x05DB;&#x05B8;&#x05D0;&#x05B5;&#x05DC;</etym>, which is 
compounded of <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05B0;&#x05D9;</etym>, who, the Adverb of Similitude <etym lang="he">&#x05DB;</etym>, and 
<etym lang="he">&#x05DC;&#x05D0;&#x05B5;</etym> God; <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  who is like God? Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&iota;&chi;&alpha;&#x1F74;&lambda;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Michael</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Moses(pn)">Moses,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; originally in the Hebr. call'd <etym lang="he">&#x05DE;&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B6;&#x05D4;</etym>, 
<etym lang="het">Mosche</etym>, <term lang="la">i.e.</term>  drawn out, the first of the Name being drawn out 
of the water by Pharaoh's Daughter. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Mu;&omega;&sigma;&#x1FC6;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Moses,</etym> 
or <etym lang="la">Moyses,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="N"><alpha>N</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Nathan(pn)">NAthan,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05EA;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym>, which origi&shy;
nally signifies, he gave. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Nu;&alpha;&theta;&#x1F70;&nu;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Nathan,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Nathanael(pn)">Nathanael,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; the same in the Hebr. 
compounded of <etym lang="he">&#x05E0;&#x05B8;&#x05EA;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym>, he gave, and <etym lang="he">&#x05D0;&#x05B5;&#x05DC;</etym>, God, <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  God gave 
him. It answers the Gr. &Theta;&epsilon;&#x1F79;&delta;&omega;&rho;&omicron;&#x03c2;. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Nu;&alpha;&theta;&alpha;&nu;&alpha;&#x1F74;&lambda;</etym>, Lat. 
<etym lang="la">Nathana&euml;l,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Nicholas(pn)">Nicholas,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Nu;&iota;&kappa;&#x1F79;&lambda;&alpha;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, which is 
again derived from <etym lang="gk">&Nu;&#x1FD6;&kappa;&omicron;&#x03c2;, &epsilon;&omicron;&#x03c2;, &tau;&#x1F78;</etym>, victory, and <etym lang="gk">&Lambda;&alpha;&#x1F78;&#x03c2;</etym>, the Peo&shy;
ple, <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  a subduer or tamer of the People. Lat. <etym lang="la">Nicholaus.</etym> </xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="O"><alpha>O</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Oliver(pn)">OLiver,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; in Lat. <etym lang="la">Olivarius;</etym> perhaps from 
the Lat. <etym lang="la">Oliva;</etym> or the Eng. <etym lang="en">Olive.</etym> </xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="P"><alpha>P</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Paul(pn)">PAul,</form> <xpln lang="en">first <etym lang="en">Saul,</etym> whence by the Hebr. call'd <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B8;&#x05D0;&#x05D5;&#x05BC;&#x05DC;</etym> 
<etym lang="het">Schaul</etym>, which comes from the Root. <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B8;&#x05D0;&#x05B7;&#x05DC;</etym> he begg'd; 
(as a Prisoner for Life;) and the word being of a Latin 
original, is by interpretation <etym lang="la">Pusillus</etym>, a Dastard or Coward. Gr. 
<etym lang="gk">&Pi;&alpha;&#x1FE6;&lambda;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Paulus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Peter(pn)">Peter,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Pi;&#x1F73;&tau;&rho;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, this again from 
the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Pi;&#x1F73;&tau;&rho;&alpha;</etym>, a Rock; for that our Saviour said to the blessed 
Apostle of that Name (he being before call'd Cephas) On this 
Rock will I build my Church, <term lang="la">i.e.</term>  on Peter. Lat. <etym lang="la">Petrus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Philip(pn)">Philip,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Phi;&#x1F77;&lambda;&iota;&pi;&pi;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, and this again 
from <etym lang="gk">&Phi;&#x1F77;&lambda;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, a lover, and <etym lang="gk">&#x1F35;&pi;&pi;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, a Horse; q. d. warlike, one 
that delights in Horses. Lat. <etym lang="la">Philippus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Priscilla(pn)">Priscilla,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; of a Latin Original, and may 
seem to come from <etym lang="la">prisca,</etym> ancient, this being a Diminutive there&shy;
of. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Pi;&rho;&#x03AF;&sigma;&kappa;&iota;&lambda;&lambda;&alpha;</etym>, id.</xpln></wordentry>
</wordgroup1>
</page> 

<page sig="L1r"> 
 <wordgroup1 type="a" object="R"><alpha>R</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Rachel(pn)">RAchel,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05E8;&#x05B8;&#x05D7;&#x05B5;&#x05DC;</etym>, which 
originally signifies, a she-Lamb. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1FEC;&alpha;&chi;&#x1F74;&lambda;</etym>, Lat. 
<etym lang="la">Rachel,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Rebecca(pn)">Rebecca,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; originally <etym lang="he">&#x05E8;&#x05B4;&#x05D1;&#x05B0;&#x05E7;&#x05B8;&#x05D0;</etym> <etym lang="het">Ribhka</etym>, which 
comes from the old Root, now out of use, <etym lang="he">&#x05E8;&#x05B0;&#x05D1;&#x05E7;</etym>, of which 
comes &#x05DE;&#x05B7;&#x05E8;&#x05B0;&#x05D1;&#x05BC;&#x05B5;&#x05E7; bloody, or fatted, or pamper'd, as a Calf for 
the Shambles. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1FEC;&epsilon;&beta;&#x1F73;&kappa;&kappa;&alpha;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Rebecca,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Ruben(pn)">Ruben,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05E8;&#x05B0;&#x05D0;&#x05D5;&#x05BC;&#x05D1;&#x05B5;&#x05DF;</etym> <etym lang="het">Reubhen</etym>, i e. 
the Son of Vision. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&#x1FEC;&omicron;&upsilon;&beta;&#x1F74;&nu;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Ruben,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="S"><alpha>S</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Samuel(pn)">SAmuel,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; in Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B0;&#x05DE;&#x05D5;&#x05BC;&#x05D0;&#x05DC;&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B0;&#x05DE;&#x05D5;&#x05BC;&#x05D0;&#x05DC;</etym> <etym lang="het">Schemuel</etym>, 
i. e. heard of God; from the Root <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B8;&#x05DE;&#x05B7;&#x05E2;</etym>, he heard, 
and <etym lang="he">&#x05D0;&#x05B5;&#x05DC;&#x05D0;&#x05B5;&#x05DC;</etym> God; for that his Father Elcana begg'd the 
first of that Name of God. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Sigma;&alpha;&mu;&omicron;&upsilon;&#x1F74;&lambda;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Samuel,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Sarah(pn)">Sarah,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C2;&#x05B8;&#x05E8;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> <etym lang="het">Sara</etym>, which 
signifies as much as Lady or Princess. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Sigma;&#x1F71;&#x1FE4;&#x1FE5;&alpha;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Sara,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Simon(pn)">Simon,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C2;&#x05B4;&#x05DE;&#x05B7;&#x05E2;</etym>, he hath heard; 
which implies Obedience. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Sigma;&#x1F77;&mu;&omega;&nu;</etym>. Lat. <etym lang="la">Simon,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Stephen(pn)">Stephen,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Sigma;&tau;&#x1F73;&phi;&alpha;&nu;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, which is again 
derived from <etym lang="gk">&sigma;&tau;&#x1F73;&phi;&omega;</etym>, whence <etym lang="gk">&sigma;&tau;&epsilon;&phi;&alpha;&nu;&#x1F79;&omega;</etym>, to crown with a Garland, &amp;c. 
It signifies a Crown or Garland. Lat. <etym lang="la">Stephanus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Susan(pn)" lexeme="Susanna(pn)">Susan or Susanna,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; possibly from the Hebr. 
Noun <etym lang="he">&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05D5;&#x05BC;&#x05E9;&#x05C1;&#x05B8;&#x05DF;</etym>, a Lily, it being certainly of an Hebr. Original. 
Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Sigma;&omicron;&upsilon;&sigma;&#x1F71;&nu;&nu;&alpha;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Susanna,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="T"><alpha>T</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Theodore(pn)">THeodore,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Theta;&epsilon;&#x1F79;&delta;&omega;&rho;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, which 
is derived from <etym lang="gk">&Theta;&epsilon;&#x1F78;&#x03c2;</etym>, God, and <etym lang="gk">&delta;&#x1FF6;&rho;&omicron;&nu;</etym>, a Gift; <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  
the gift of God. Lat. <etym lang="la">Theodorus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Theophilus(pn)">Theophilus,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Theta;&epsilon;&#x1F79;&phi;&iota;&lambda;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, 
which comes again from <etym lang="gk">&Theta;&epsilon;&#x1F78;&#x03c2;</etym>, and <etym lang="gk">&phi;&#x1F77;&lambda;&omega;</etym>, I love; <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  beloved 
of God; or a Lover of God. Lat. <etym lang="la">Theophilus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Thomas(pn)">Thomas,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; originally in the Syr. call'd <etym lang="sy">&#x05EA;&#x05BC;&#x05B4;&#x05D0;&#x05D9;&#x05DE;&#x05D5;</etym> 
<etym lang="syt">Thaumo</etym>, in Hebr. <etym lang="he">&#x05EA;&#x05B8;&#x05D0;&#x05C4;&#x05DD;</etym> <term lang="la">i.e.</term>  twofold: for this reason Tho&shy;
mas was call'd &Delta;&#x1F77;&delta;&upsilon;&mu;&omicron;&#x03c2;, of two hearts, because of his doubting; 
he would believe, and he would not. Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Theta;&omega;&mu;&#x1FB6;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Thomas</etym> 
or <etym lang="la">Thoma,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</page> 

<page sig="L1v"> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Timothy(pn)">Timothy,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Tau;&iota;&mu;&#x1F79;&theta;&epsilon;&omicron;&#x03c2;</etym>, and this a&shy;
gain from <etym lang="gk">&tau;&iota;&mu;&#x1F71;&omega;</etym>, to honour, and <etym lang="gk">&Theta;&epsilon;#x1F79;&#x03c2;</etym>, God; <term lang="la">q.d.</term>  a Worshipper 
or Honourer of God. Lat. <etym lang="la">Timotheus,</etym> id.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="V"><alpha>V</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Vincent(pn)">VIncent,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; from the Lat. <etym lang="la">Vincentius,</etym> this 
from <etym lang="la">vinco,</etym> to overcome; or from <etym lang="la">vincio,</etym> to bind.</xpln></wordentry> 

<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Ursula(pn)">Vrsula,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Womans Name; from the Lat. <etym lang="la">Ursula,</etym> which 
originally sign. the little Bear, a Constellation so call'd.</xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

<wordgroup1 type="a" object="Z"><alpha>Z</alpha> 
<wordentry type="h"><form lang="en" lexeme="Zachary(pn)">ZAchary,</form> <xpln lang="en">a Man's Name; in the Hebr. it was call'd 
<etym lang="he">&#x05D5;&#x05B0;&#x05DB;&#x05B7;&#x05E8;&#x05B0;&#x05D9;&#x05B8;&#x05D4;</etym> <etym lang="het">Secharja</etym>, which sign. the memory of the Lord. 
Gr. <etym lang="gk">&Zeta;&alpha;&chi;&alpha;&rho;&#x1F77;&alpha;&#x03c2;</etym>, Lat. <etym lang="la">Zacharias.</etym> </xpln></wordentry> 
</wordgroup1> 

Observe that most, if not all, Proper 
Names of Men and Women, not found 
in this Appendix, occurr in the prece&shy;
ding Etymology of Proper Names. 

<term lang="la">FINIS.</term> 
</section> 
</page> 
<page sig="L2r"> 
</page> 
</leme>
